intro: Eleocharis laeviglumis, commonly known as the smooth-beaked sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as marshes and wetlands. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Its flowers are usually green or brown and are adapted for wind pollination. Eleocharis laeviglumis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and semi-aquatic organisms.
